Description: Wall sherd of East Greek (North Ionian) black-figured pottery bowl; interior: streaky brown glaze with frieze of alternating tongues and lotus flowers painted in red and white, details incised. Exterior, cream slip: two friezes separated by band with superimposed red bands lined in white; upper frieze has part of a goat to right, head no doubt turned; below, lotus flower and bud chain.
Curator's comments: Joins 1888,0601.534a-c & from same bowl as e-g. A sherd in the British School at Athens probably belongs (Smith 2009, cat.2)
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.232)
